item.title: Taylew's Ruined Forge Walkthrough in Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Reach Taylew's Ruined Forge in Elden Ring DLC
  • Taylew's Ruined Forge Complete Guide

Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree is a huge DLC for an already massive title. It introduces dozens of new dungeons, catacombs, and hidden areas for players to discover in the Land of Shadow. One of these is Taylew's Ruined Forge.

Home to three Smithscript weapons, Taylew's Ruined Forge can be found in the Ancient Ruins of Rauh. Tarnished looking to complete their collection of all of the new weapons introduced in the DLC won't want to miss clearing this dungeon.

How to Reach Taylew's Ruined Forge in Elden Ring DLC

Taylew's Ruined Forge can be found just north of the Ancient Ruins Base Site of Grace , at the northwestern corner of the map (location detailed above). Summon Torrent to ride along the road, and you will reach a marble structure with a lit brazier. The entrance to the Ruined Forge is a small archway that's easy to miss. Enter to find Taylew's Ruined Forge Site of Grace.

To reach the Ancient Ruins Base Site of Grace, take the hidden path behind the Statue of Marika at the edge of the pond directly north of the Moorth Ruins .

Taylew's Ruined Forge Complete Guide

From the Taylew's Ruined Forge Site of Grace, go down the tunnel to reach a balcony overlooking a lake of lava. Pick up the Shadow Realm Rune [3] from the corpse next to the railing and take the stairs to the left. Take care of the Lava Slime that drops from the ceiling and use the ladder to climb down.

Jump across the small gap in the broken floor and enter the chamber to the left. There is a Golem Smith sitting in an ambush to the right. Pick up the Smithscript Axe behind him, and head back the way you came.

Golem Smiths are extremely slow; they won't give chase.

Back in the lava room, you'll see a large metal pipe you can use as a walkway. Take a running start and jump on the protruding section to land safely. Jump to the crumbling stone balcony on the other side to find the Smithscript Greathammer behind a Lava Slime. Pick it up and get back on the pipe.

This time, follow the pipe towards the top until you can see two balconies you can jump to: one to the left and one to the right. Go left first and pick up the Smithing Stone [4] from the corpse on the ground. There are two Golem Smiths ready to fight here. Ignore them and go to the back of the room where the second Golem Smith is standing. There will be an Ancient Dragon Smithing Stone on a corpse right next to the metal pipe. Pick it up and jump back on the pipe.

The two Golem Smiths on this balcony can be tricky to take down. Use heavy weapons with high poise damage and backstab the red gem on their backs to deal massive damage.

Head to the balcony on the right this time. The room to the right leads back to the pipe, and the tunnel in front of you progresses deeper into the Ruined Forge. Go through the tunnel to find a room with two more Golem Smiths and a Lava Slime. Walk up the broken pillar to the section where the Lava Pot-wielding Golem is, and you'll find the Smithscript Shield on a corpse. Turn back around, and you'll see a balcony you can jump over. Do so to drop down to the floor below.

Turn right and pick up the Smithing Stone [8] from the corpse next to the wall. There will be a small tunnel behind just before this corpse with a ladder inside. Take the ladder to go up to the last section. There will be a platform with a Golem Smith and a Lava Slime directly behind you after you climb the ladder with a corpse that has a Somber Smithing Stone [3] . Go up the stairs in front of the ladder and pull the lever at the far end of the room to the left. This will trigger a mechanism to change the direction of the large metal pipe.

Drop down to the metal platform below this room, and then down again to the stone floor. Go down the stairs, and you will see a corpse with Somber Smithing Stone [8] on it next to a hole in the wall.

Look down, and you'll see a part of the metal pipe you can jump to from this hole. Turn left, and run up the pipe until you see a balcony on either side.

Jump left and take the stairs to reach the final altar. Interact with the altar to obtain Taylew the Golem Smith Spirit Ash, and another Ancient Dragon Smithing Stone .

item.title: How To Craft Eternal Sleep Pots In Elden Ring: Shadow Of The Erdtree
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Where To Get St. Trina Disciple's Cookbook [1]
  • How To Craft Eternal Sleep Pots In Shadow Of The Erdtree

Elden Ring: Shadow Of The Erdtree gives players all sorts of tools to help deal with the many new enemies they will be facing throughout the DLC. These new tools range from new weapons, spells, ashes of war, and even new status effects.

The new status effect in Shadow Of The Erdtree is known as Eternal Sleep, which really does put weaker enemies into an eternal sleep. This status effect is very powerful and can make clearing out legacy dungeons a breeze, with Eternal Sleep Pots letting any player take advantage of the new effect.

Where To Get St. Trina Disciple's Cookbook [1]

To craft an Eternal Sleep Pot , players will first need to find St. Trina Disciple's Cookbook [1] which is found after reaching the Cerulean Coast. Continue traveling south until you reach the Cerulean Coast Cross Site of Grace, just east of the major peninsula. Head back north up the major hill using the large stone coffin and head towards the dead white tree near the center of the hill . There will be a ghost-like enemy guarding the area, with the Cookbook being looted from the dead body sitting near the tree.

How To Craft Eternal Sleep Pots In Shadow Of The Erdtree

Once players have the recipe, they will need:

  • 1 Whiteflesh Mushroom
  • 1 Deep-Purple Lily
  • 1 Ritual Pot

Whiteflesh Mushrooms are glowing white mushrooms found low to the ground. Deep-purple lilies go to about chest level and stand out even against the blues of the Cerulean Coast as they tower over most of the surrounding grass. Both of these materials are found throughout the Cerulean Coast and can be easily farmed by exploring randomly on the coast or in the Stone Coffin Fissure.

There are ten ritual pots found throughout Elden Ring , with them being reusable after an Eternal Sleep Pot is thrown . While it will usually take a few sleeping pots to make an enemy fall asleep, these pots can be incredibly efficient in taking down groups of enemies and making them fall into an Eternal Sleep.

Eternal Sleep works a lot like regular sleep in how it builds up on enemies. For weaker enemies throughout the world, they will fall asleep and stay asleep forever, no matter how many times the player attacks them or how long they wait. Stronger enemies and bosses can still be put to sleep, but the effect will only be temporary , yet still longer than regular sleep.

item.title: New York Times Strands Hints and Answers for July 10, 2024
item.description:
Strands has yet another puzzle to ponder over. There are several themed words hidden inside the 6x8 letter grid, and it can be a big challenge to find them all, especially if you don't like the in-game hint system.

If you already know how to play Strands , but you are stuck on today's puzzle, this article is here for you. You can find general hints, spoilers, explanations, and the full answer to today's puzzle if you need it. No matter what you are looking for, you can find it below.

The NYT Games Strands Puzzle #129 for July 10, 2024

The Strands puzzle for today has the clue In Neverland . It has seven items to find: one Spangram and six themed words.

New York Times Games Strands Clues

If you want some general hints for this free browser-based game, you can find three in the sections below. Click the Read More button below one of the Hint sections below to see this spoiler-free hint to guide you closer to the theme.

General Hint 2

General Hint 3

If you are still stuck on this mobile-friendly puzzle game, check out the two word spoilers below. You can find one spoiled theme word in each along with the word's position in the letter grid.

Spoiler 1

Spoiler 2

The Answer to Today's New York Times Games Strands

Just want to see the full answer? In the expandable section below is the complete spoiler for today's Strands , including all the themed words and where they are in the letter jumble.

Today's Strands Explained

If you want an explanation for the New York Times Games Strands , you can find it in the section below. In it, you can see how the clue, the themed words, and the Spangram all go together.

Want to play? Check out the New York Times Games Strands website available on almost any device with a browser.

item.title: Where To Get Furnace Visages In Elden Ring: Shadow Of The Erdtree
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Where To Get Furnace Visages In Shadow Of The Erdtree
  • What Are Furnace Visages Used For?

Elden Ring: Shadow Of The Erdtree introduces massive flaming enemies known as Furnace Golems. These enemies walk throughout various regions in the Realm Of Shadow and will attack any players that get too close but offer powerful new tears for those who can take them down.

Despite them being completely on fire, the weakness of these creatures is throwing massive flaming pots into the opening on their head, which is a requirement to take down the armored variants. The best pots to throw is a Hefty Furnace Pot , and those require a Furnace Visage to craft; here's where to get them.

Where To Get Furnace Visages In Shadow Of The Erdtree

Furnace Visages are a limited crafting material as they can only be obtained from Furnace Golems and picked up in a specific location. The main method for obtaining Furnace Visages is by defeating Furnace Golems, which drop one a piece . When first starting the DLC, players should target the non-armored variants as they can be taken down by attacking their legs to knock them down for a critical strike.

As players progress through the DLC, they can travel to the optional area known as the Abyssal Woods. On your way to the Abyssal Woods, players will pass through a lake full of destroyed Furnace Golems, and an alive one. Among the destroyed Golems players will find seven Furnace Visages , with one more being obtained by defeating the alive Furnace Golem hiding among the remnants. After players have obtained a few Furnace Visages, they can take on the Armored Furnace Golems, which will still only reward one Furnace Visage.

What Are Furnace Visages Used For?

The only thing Furnace Visages are used for is crafting Hefty Furnace Pots , which deal an incredible amount of damage to Furnace Golems. While these pots can be used against other enemies, they offer the easiest method for defeating Furnace Golems and should be used to defeat all of them first. Players can still try to defeat Furnace Golems using Hefty Fire Pots or other ranged attacks or fire consumables, but these options will take much more time than just a few Hefty Furnace Pots. The recipe for these pots is:

  • 2 Redflesh Mushroom
  • 2 Ember of Messmer
  • 1 Furnace Visage
  • 2 Hefty Cracked Pot

Embers of Messmer can be found throughout the Realm of Shadow, and are fairly easy to come by. Hefty Cracked Pots are much rarer but can be reused after the Hefty Furnace Pot is thrown .

item.title: New York Times Connections Hints and Answers for #395 July 10, 2024
item.description:
Connections is back with another challenging word-sorting puzzle. If you are stuck on this challenging puzzle game, you can find all the help you need here in this article.
